intro: Gundelia siirtica, commonly known as the Siirt gum plant, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gundelia siirtica is known for its sticky resinous secretions, which have been used traditionally in some regions.
